paper_abstract: Sokal in 2001 proved that the complex zeros of the chromatic polynomial P-G(q) of any graph G lie in the disc vertical bar q vertical bar < 7.963907 Delta, where Delta is the maximum degree of G. This result answered a question posed by Brenti, Royle and Wagner in 1994 and hence proved a conjecture proposed by Biggs, Damerell and Sands in 1972. Borgs gave a short proof of Sokal's result. Fernandez and Procacci recently improved Sokal's result to vertical bar q vertical bar < 6.91 Delta. In this paper, we shall show that all real zeros of P-G(q) are in the interval [0, 5.664 Delta). For the special case that Delta = 3, all real zeros of P-G(q) are in the interval [0, 4.765 Delta).
paper_title: Bounds For The Real Zeros of Chromatic Polynomials
